intro: Spicanta finlaysoniana, commonly known as the Finlayson's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its milky sap and showy floral structures. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered in a crown-like arrangement, with bright yellow to orange hues. Spicanta finlaysoniana is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
